title: "I'm just a normal person": Beckham calls in cops over fears of 'more embarrassing revelations including BANTER with mates' - Mirror Online
text:

Football hero David Beckham has called in cops over fears 'more embarrassing revelations will leak including BANTER with mates'. 
The ex-England captain is still reeling from the details of angry emails between him and his advisers becoming public knowledge on Friday - dubbed 'The Beckileaks'. 
The messages - which were revealed on a website called Football Leaks and published by media in Europe - accompanied by reports that Beckham 'carried out charity work in a bid to earn a knighthood'. 
In a foul-mouthed outburst it is said that he called the Honours Committee "unappreciative c****" - and allegedly slammed other stars getting awards. 
And the reports claimed that the Unicef ambassador 'demanded the charity pay for a business-class flight for him to attend an event - to which he took a private jet'. 
While still to comment publicly, in an attempt to pour cold water on the revelations yesterday, Beckham insisted through friends he was simply a "normal person" who was just "extremely disappointed" at being passed over for a knighthood. David Beckham lights The Empire State Building blue in honour of UNICEF's 70th anniversary last December (Photo: WireImage) 
The PR spin appears to be backfiring today however - with the new comments having been at best described as "extraordinary". 
A source close to the former Real Madrid midfielder told The Mail on Sunday the emails were written "in the heat of the moment". 
They told the newspaper: "David is just like any normal person and he was extremely disappointed that he wasn’t deemed worthy of becoming a Sir. Read More David Beckham watches son Brooklyn skateboarding amid furore over hacked emails about his knighthood snub 
"He is a passionate man. He gets very passionate about his work and particularly about his country, Great Britain. That’s what drives him. 
"He spent a lot of time and effort getting the London Olympics to the UK which had such a positive effect on so many people, but for it not to be acknowledged made him very emotional. Who wouldn’t be?" 
As 'Brand Beckham' crumbles, today the ex-Manchester United legend is reportedly scared of more leaks - "conversations between him and his PR Simon Oliveira and best pal Dave Gardner " - which it's feared could further tarnish his reputation. Beckham stands with his wife Victoria as he shows off his OBE in 2003 (Photo: Getty) 
The Sun on Sunday reports that his representatives have spoken to specialist investigators in Portugal about the shattering links. 
A source told the newspaper: "David fears some very personal details are set to be released, especially as he often speaks very candidly about all sorts of things going on (in) his life. 
"Gardner has been with David since day one and is one of his closest confidants. They share pretty much everything. 
“David is also very close to Oliveira, who has been with him for years and been instrumental in building up his brand. Read More David Beckham "doesn't care about knighthood" after "doctored" leaked email revealed four-letter rant 
“Over the years they have spoken in detail about David’s career and his life after football, as well as the mundane talk about the business. 
“At the same time they are friends who have a bit of banter so there might be a fair bit of embarrassing material in the emails too. 
“It would be the same with anyone’s emails being read in public.” Unicef Goodwill Ambassador David Beckham visits children in Swaziland in 2015 (Photo: PA) 
The newspaper quoted sources in Portugal saying its Policia Judiciária was investigating the hacked emails. 
A source said: “The cyber-crime unit is involved and they are taking it extremely seriously. It has gone right to the top. 
“They have confirmed they are investigating a serious case of football leaks, without actually naming Beckham. Read More Fans insist David Beckham is given a knighthood despite THOSE leaked emails 
“But the feeling is that they have spoken to Beckham’s people and they are very keen to get to the bottom of this and find the hacker.” 
The newspaper reports sources in Portugal confirming the country’s Policia Judiciária was investigating the allegedly hacked emails. Unicef has said it is "extremely proud" of its work with David Beckham (Photo: PA) 
It told them: “The cyber-crime unit is involved and they are taking it extremely seriously. It has gone right to the top. 
“They have confirmed they are investigating a serious case of football leaks, without actually naming Beckham. 
“But the feeling is that they have spoken to Beckham’s people and they are very keen to get to the bottom of this and find the hacker.” 
Beckham - who has donated more than £1m to Unicef - denies he used his charity work as part of a conscious effort to win an honour. 
Good Morning Britain host Piers Morgan wrote on Twitter: "Oh. My. God. RIP Brand Beckham.... 
"Nobody will be envious of David Beckham by tomorrow. They will be sickened by him." 
He later added: "We can forget about 'Sir David Beckham' ever happening." 'The Beckileaks' emails with PR man Simon Oliveira : 
Beckham on the Honours Committee: 
"They’re a bunch of c**** I expected nothing less... Who decides on the honors? (sic) It’s a disgrace to be honest and if I was American I would of (sic) got something like this 10 years ago... It’s p****d me off those old unappreciative c****." 
Beckham to Oliveira: 
"Katherine Jenkins OBE for what? Singing at the rugby and going to see the troops plus admitting to taking coke… F joke and if you get asked we should think of a cutting remark." 
Oliveira to Beckham: 
"My honest advice to you is that we should not do anything that jeopardises it and remain positive… Why waste time on a cutting remark as that will only rile the committee? We need to remain dignified if asked but if you want me to work up something cutting I will work up one but my advice is it’s not productive." 
Beckham to Oliveira: 
"I agree but it’s p****d me off those old unappreciative c****." 
Beckham on suggestions that he should put $1 million into a Unicef dinner: 
"I don’t want to put my personal money into this cause… To pour this million into the fund is like putting my own money in. If there was no fund, the money would be for me. This f money is mine." Like us on Facebook
